channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 9 clustered potholes first reported in April, 28th June
item.description:
These were marked for attention in May. Nothing done yet while another pothole I reported 50m up the road was filled.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, The Bishops Avenue, Hampstead Garden Suburb, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree needs pruning outside number 50, 28th June
item.description:
The tree needs a prune as the growth is obstructing the pavement and meaning you need to duck as you walk down the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mackenzie Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree roots breaking up pavement and tree overhanging, 28th June
item.description:
Tree outside 99 Kingsway is continuing to break up the pavement and is a trip hazard (I have had a recent trip there following hip surgery and my concern is that either myself or my elderly mother will have a more serious accident). Additionally previous repairs have also meant that the level of the pavement is now significantly higher up my garden wall increasing the trip hazard. The tree also needs pruning as it is overhanging the pavement and obstruction by vision out of my drive.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsway, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No 160, Tree overhanging pavement, 28th June
item.description:
This tree at number 160 has grown out over the pavement and lower branches mean you have to duck to avoid it or stand awkwardly if waiting at the bus stop.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large branch dead hanging down, 28th June
item.description:
There is a dead branch quite big, further into the tree causing the hanging down over the pavement. On inspection it looks quite extensive and needs to be removed before it falls. Thank you Location near no 4 Spencer road on pavement by entrance to Ravensdale and Foxleas Court. I’ve noticed it a week or so ago.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Spencer Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continued disturbance, 28th June
item.description:
Again before 5am this morning. Neighbours complaining of the noise coming in the Allotments. This is happening 2-3 times a week currently. Banging and crashing of the locks and gates. Number plate will be provided on request.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 297, Old Farm Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yet another large Flytip, 28th June
item.description:
There has been another large Flytip last night not 12 feet from the one that was partially blocking the entrance last week to the Weir Hall Avenue cul de sac in N18. This one is on the grass to the right of the entrance and was made yesterday just before midnight by what looked like a dark coloured van. Instead of just clearing these up at the Enfield residents expense, when are the council going to investigate these matters? As I stated last week, surely in these days of doorbell and CCTV cameras you could get some kind of evidence for a prosecution??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Weir Hall Avenue, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet
